pet.name: TOBY
pet.description: Toby is a very sweet dog who has some special needs. Toby has a grade 4/6 heart murmur which requires medication, and has itchy skin that also requires medication to treat. But even with all of that, Toby is an amazing dog with so much love to give. He loves children and other dogs, and is indifferent to cats. Toby does need work with potty training.

pet.name: KHALIFA
pet.description: Khalifa's owner was keeping him at their apartment without the landlord's permission, and so when the landlord found out they had to place him in a shelter. Khalifa is nervous around men BUT does just fine when he realizes you're an okay person. He adores women. He should not live with other dogs or with cats. He has lived with children and he loves them. Khalifa's owner said he is potty trained. He is very nervous here at the shelter and REALLY needs to find his forever home soon.

pet.name: Diamond
pet.description:
Diamond is a sweet loving girl who is good with kids and other dogs.
Visit http://www.gsdri.org/dog.php?dogID=286
Visit www.gsdri.org to fill out an application and learn more about our adoption process. Our dogs are all fostered in volunteer homes. Meets and greets are only available by appointment after the application has been processed.
All of our dogs are adopted as indoor house pets. No permanent outside runs or tie outs are allowed.
Adoption fees: $250.00
*BREED DISCLOSURE: Due to the fact that most of our adoptable dogs come from shelters, we can not guarantee their breed. We list the dog's breed as the one that best matches the physical appearance, temperament, and personality of the dog - in some cases it's purely a guess.

pet.name: Diesel
pet.description: All of our dogs are either spayed or neutered. They have been given a distemper and bordetella vaccination, flea treatment, and have been wormed. Since our adoption fee is so low ($35) why not consider a tax free donation. Your support is a key ingredient in the continued success of our shelter. An application must be completed and approved if you would like to adopt a dog from the Story County Animal Shelter. The staff here at the shelter works very hard to find just the right home for each animal that comes through the door. For more information please call us at 515-382-3338.

pet.name: Franco
pet.description: Hi, I am Franco. I am probably the biggest goofball you will meet at BAHS. I am always excited to see you and will love running and playing with you in our new yard. I want to be on the go and active... all the time. I am good with other dogs and just want to run and play with them too.

pet.name: Logan
pet.description: No cats

pet.name: Geddy
pet.description: "My names Geddy, and I'm a Hound Dog!" Adopt sweet Geddy and you will get a dog full of silly personality. His big ears and feet will make you smile as you watch him run across your yard to sniff out that pesky rabbit he just saw. Geddy does great with other dogs his size and really just wants to roam the yard and do his thing. Geddy isn't too sure about those cats at the shelter, he gets his big hound dog Aroooo going when he sees them. Anyone looking to adopt pure joy has found it in Geddy.

pet.name: Dory
pet.description: Hey everyone, meet Dory. Dory is a sweet girl who was an owner surrender. Dory isn't fond of other animals getting in her space. She most definitely has a personal bubble and will nip at those who aren't welcome. However, after she gets to know you and knows she can trust you she welcomes all the head scratches you're willing to give. Dory's foster mom thinks that she would do best in a home where Dory can be the center of attention and with no young kids. Dory is approx 7 years old and looking to find her forever home. She does ok with other dogs as long as they don't get in her face and cats are not a problem. Once she is used to the surroundings she is content with other animals. She just prefers to not be jumped on by them and she isn't afraid to let them know who is in charge. Do you think you would be a good fit for her? Please call BAHS to set up an appointment to meet Dory.

pet.name: Holly
pet.description: If looking into Holly's eyes doesn't make you fall in love her BIG personality will. Holly loves to play fetch and just play in general. However, she has no brakes and will run to you full speed when called. Holly would love a home where she can be the center of attention and with older kids who can handle her rambunctious behavior.

pet.name: Emma
pet.description: Emma will take time to trust new people. Once she puts her butt in the air and her head on the ground, though, you know you have found a loyal friend for life! She loves having her butt scratched and tummy rubbed. Adopters should be prepared to continue counter-conditioning to new people.

pet.name: Jazz
pet.description:
Hi, my name is Jazz. I am so much fun, I love to jump and play. I may be what some call "hyper" when you see me in my kennel, but don't let that fool you, once I get outside I calm down and love to have all of your attention. I play nicely with other dogs my size.... oh looks squirrel.....
This sweet girl loves attention! She is still working on her manners (she can jump up and be mouthy), but would be a great companion for someone who is willing to do some training with her!

pet.name: BGR Chewbacca
pet.description: Meet Chewbacca, he is learning the live after retirement. He is doing well in a home with cats and another greyhound. He is doing stairs and loves car rides! If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at adopt@heartlandgreyhoundadoption.org or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. The adoption fee for greyhounds through HGA is $275. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $10.99 which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. Each dog also comes with a special sighthound collar and leash set and muzzle. There is a $25 non-refundable application fee that is applied to an approved adoption.

pet.name: BGR C Three P O
pet.description: Winter weather updates for meet & greets and other events: In case of inclement winter weather, check the Heartland Greyhound Adoption Facebook page for last-minute updates. Or follow us on Facebook and have those updates delivered to your newsfeed! If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at adopt@heartlandgreyhoundadoption.org or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. The adoption fee for greyhounds through HGA is $275. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $10.99 which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. Each dog also comes with a special sighthound collar and leash set and muzzle. There is a $25 non-refundable application fee that is applied to an approved adoption.

pet.name: Superior Cinch
pet.description: If you would like to meet this dog, please e-mail HGA at adopt@heartlandgreyhoundadoption.org or call 515-967-6564 (please leave a message) and we will get back to you as soon as possible with more information. The adoption fee for senior greyhounds age 7 and older through HGA is $200. This fee pays for medical costs including spay/neuter surgery, shots, parasite treatments, and teeth cleaning. HGA also microchips every greyhound prior to adoption as a permanent form of ID. The additional cost for this service is $10.99 which covers the chip, activation, and membership and is a substantial savings over the usual cost for microchipping. Each dog also comes with a special sighthound collar and leash set and muzzle. There is a $25 non-refundable application fee that is applied to an approved adoption.

pet.name: Lucky
pet.description: Hi! My name is Lucky! I am almost 2 years old and I am looking for my Furever home! I’m very energetic and love to play with my foster siblings! I would like a quiet home with no kids. Cats are okay though! I am trained by Bark Avenue and will need a strong leader in my home who recognizes my stress. If you’re interested in meeting me, please apply at hopeanimalrescueofiowa.org.

pet.name: Harper
pet.description:
Harper is a Coon Hound/Boxer mix approximately 1-2 yrs of age. If you are looking for a loyal best friend, you found her!! She will be VERY loyal to her owner an loves to lay on or beside you. She is a cuddler and will want to lay in your bed. She does well with cats and dogs that are her size or smaller (she does not do well with larger dogs) and loves playing with her foster fur siblings. She graduated from Bark Avenue 10 day basic training boot camp, so she has basic commands. We are working on getting some weight on her as she was found as a stray and very thin and abused, so it is amazing she is so loyal and sweet. She does well in a car. Children 10+ would be recommended for Harper and homes without smaller critters (birds, hamsters, guinea pigs, etc.).
If you would like to meet Harper, please complete an online application at http://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.org/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Todd
pet.description:
Chabs (Lab Retriever/Chihuahua) Mix -- Born 12/30/18
Siblings: Sutter, Tippy, Oreo, Samantha, Todd, Luther, Lex, and Columbus

pet.name: Keija
pet.description: If you would like to meet Keija, please apply https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Tulip
pet.description:
Doberman/Cattle Dog Mix puppies -momma was stolen when they were 4 1/2 weeks old.
Siblings: Callum, Freesia, Primrose, Neil, Lilac, Tulip, Finn, Peony, Rose
DOB: 1/24/19
If interested in meeting, please complete online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Parker
pet.description:
Parker is a male Border Collie Mix born in Oct'18. His adoption fee is $250.00
If interested in meeting, please complete online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Trinity
pet.description:
Trinity is a female Sheppard/Heeler Mix born in Oct'18. His adoption fee is $250.00
If interested in meeting, please complete online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Brody
pet.description:
Brody is a 6 year old male Pomeranian/Chihuahua mix. This boy is adorable! He is dog friendly with the proper introduction and loves people as long as he is allowed to come to them instead of being pursued when he first meets them. He seems to be house trained as well. He is the best lap dog! Brody is good with older respectful children, but will need supervision with younger children to see if he is compatible. He has had a back experience with a young child, so may be apprehensive to be around them. His adoption fee is $200.
If interested in meeting, please complete online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application

pet.name: Stokely
pet.description:
Stokely is a male Husky Mix born in Oct'18. His adoption fee is $250.00
He is very affectionate, loves to lay by you. He does well on a leash, he doesn't pull and his foster has been able to put the leash down and he stays by her. He plays well with other dogs and children. He is a very loyal dog . He is crate trained and potty trained.
If interested in meeting, please complete online application at https://hopeanimalrescueofiowa.duplie.com/forms/196/dog-application
